intro: Neonauclea pallida subsp. pallida, commonly known as the white neonauclea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale green leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. The fruit is a small, smooth capsule that contains several seeds.
